headline.main: U.S. Agency Says Many Adults Are Losing Battle to Slim Down

docs.abstract: Natl Health Statistics Center figures reveal Amer adults, many of them overweight, do not appear to be succeeding in battle to slim down to what are considered, for health or esthetic reasons, to be more desirable weights; indicate that avg man surveyed in '71-74 weighs 4 lbs more than he did in similar survey decade earlier; compared with 'desirable weights' established by Met Life Ins Co, avg Amer man is 20-30 lbs overweight and avg Amer woman 15-30 lbs; Sydney Abraham, who prepared rept, comments; chart indicating weights of men and women (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: American adults, many of them overweight, do not appear to be succeeding in their battle to slim down to what are considered, for health or esthetic reasons, to be more desirable weights.
docs.snippet: American adults, many of them overweight, do not appear to be succeeding in their battle to slim down to what are considered, for health or esthetic reasons, to be more desirable weights.
